name: Watermelon Sorbet
description: This three-ingredient watermelon sorbet is so tasty, you won\'t be able to keep enough watermelon on hand to match the demand. No ice cream maker needed!

recipeInstructions.name: Prepare the simple syrup
recipeInstructions.text: In a small saucepan, bring sugar and water to a boil. Cook and stir until sugar is dissolved; set aside.

recipeInstructions.name: Prepare the sorbet base
recipeInstructions.text: In a blender or food processor, process the watermelon in batches until pureed. Transfer to a large bowl; stir in the sugar syrup and lemon juice.

Combine the simple syrup and sorbet base Pour the mixture into a 13x9-inch dish; cover and freeze for eight hours, or until firm. Just before serving, puree the watermelon sorbet in batches until smooth. Editor’s Tip: If desired, garnish with fresh mint leaves.

review.reviewBody: Refreshingly delicious!  However, next time I would use less sugar, it was a little too sweet for us.  Kids would love adding  chocolate chips for the seeds.   This was my first sorbet at home, it was actually really easy, I will definitely be trying different flavors.  I’m thinking lemon, strawberry would be a nice combo.
